# Brewing in the Dark

## Scripture

"For you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God's special possession, that you may declare the praises of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light." 
1 Peter 2:9 (NIV)

## Reflection

As we pour over our coffee, the darkness of the morning is illuminated by the rich aroma of freshly brewed beans. Just as this process requires patience and attention to detail, our faith journey demands a willingness to walk in the darkness, trusting that God is at work. We must be willing to be "roasted" by trials and "ground" by our own failures, allowing the heat of our struggles to refine us into the vessels of His light. As we emerge from the darkness, we are transformed, bearing the sweet aroma of Christ's presence. This process, though uncomfortable, is essential for the extraction of our true character and the development of a rich, full-bodied faith.

## Prayer

We ask that You, Lord, would allow us to endure the darkness, trusting in Your refining work in our lives, and that we might emerge transformed, bearing Your light and presence to a world in need.

## One-Line Application

We must trust in God's refining work to transform us into vessels of His light and presence.
